name: Social Communication Anxiety Disorder (SCAD)
chief_complaint: I can't talk to people at school without feeling like I'll say something stupid
physical_findings: visible trembling when speaking to authority figures
treatment: cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) with social skills training
consideration of SSRI if impairing function
prognosis: Good with early intervention, though may require long-term management during developmental transitions
description: A developmental anxiety disorder characterized by disproportionate distress in social communication contexts, distinct from generalized social anxiety by its specific manifestation in verbal expression difficulties and situational mutism episodes. Typically emerges during middle school years.
